properties.name: _defaultWidth
properties.description: Sets the default width of the component in pixels.

properties.name: _defaultHeight
properties.description: Sets the default height of the component in pixels.

properties.name: _minimumWidth
properties.description: Sets the minimum width of the component in pixels.

properties.name: _minimumHeight
properties.description: Sets the minimum height of the component in pixels.

properties.name: width
properties.description: Sets the width of the component in pixels.

properties.name: height
properties.description: Sets the height of the component in pixels.

properties.name: seriesColorList
properties.description: Defines an colors in order that will be used for series.

properties.name: chartData
properties.description:
This attribute defines the series data to be charted. It needs to
be passed in as a 1D array or as a multi-dimensional array containing
one or more arrays of numeric values.

properties.name: legendLabels
properties.description:
This attribute defines the custom text labels for your bar chart
legend. Pass in the values as an array of strings.
properties.defaultValue: ["Bar One","Bar Two","Bar Three","Bar Four","Bar Five","Bar Six","Bar Seven","Bar Eight","Bar Nine","Bar Ten","Bar Eleven","Bar Twelve","Bar Thirteen","Bar Fourteen","Bar Fifteen"]

properties.name: colors
properties.description:
This attribute configures custom bar colors. Pass in the desired
values as an array of hexadecimal value color strings. Prefer
settings the colors as CSS style variables to fit in with
other theming capabilities. Setting the colors attribute directly
will override all default colors and any CSS style variable themes.


Example setting colors as an attribute:

```
  <px-simple-horizontal-bar-chart
      ...
      colors=['#5da5da', '#faa43a', '#60bd68']>
  </px-simple-horizontal-bar-chart>
```

Example setting colors with CSS style variables:

```
  <style>
    :root {
      --px-vis-series-color-0: #5da5da;
      --px-vis-series-color-1: #faa43a;
      --px-vis-series-color-2: #60bd68;
    }
  </style>
  <px-simple-horizontal-bar-chart ...>
  </px-simple-horizontal-bar-chart>
```

properties.name: barLabels
properties.description:
Sets the format to apply to the labels beside each bar. Choose from
'percentage' or 'values'.

properties.name: domainMin
properties.description:
The data's minimum extent on the X-axis. Used to set the D3 domain on the X scale.
You should only reset if you have a negative value. If you have a
positive value, leave it at default 0.

properties.name: domainMax
properties.description: The data's maximum extent on the X-axis. Used to set the D3 domain on the X scale.

methods.name: attached
methods.description:
Polymer fires this event automatically, we use it to define
this.svg and initiate the component

methods.name: _drawChart
methods.description: Removes previous chart, draws new chart. Debounced.

methods.name: _removeChart
methods.description: Removes previous chart contents. Debounced.

methods.name: _removeChartDebounced
methods.description:
Resizes the SVG element and clears any internal
contents. This is necessary between redrawing the chart.
Depends on this.svg being a D3 selection of the chart's SVG element.

methods.name: _addStyleScope
methods.description:
Adds the style-scope class of the component to all SVG
child nodes. This is necessary because Polymer, while applying the class
to child HTML elements, does not apply the class to child SVG elements

methods.name: _addStyleScopeToElement
methods.description:
Pass in a d3 selection and this function will ensure that
Polymer style-scope is applied.

methods.name: _clearSVG
methods.description:
Selects the SVG of the chart, shrinks it to 1px by 1px and
empties it of child elements. This is necessary to do before drawing or
redrawing the chart.

methods.name: _getSeriesTotal
methods.description: Returns the sum of the values of a series.

methods.name: _getLongestSeries
methods.description: Returns the longest series based on the array of series passed.

methods.name: _calculateTextSize
methods.description:
Method returns the size of an SVG text element and
its position relative to the viewport.

The essential DOM function is getBoundingClientRect():
https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Element/getBoundingClientRect

Returns a rect object with the following properties:

   height - float - Height of the rectangle box (This is identical to bottom minus top). Read only.
   width - float - Width of the rectangle box (This is identical to right minus left). Read only.
   top - float - Y-coordinate, relative to the viewport origin, of the top of the rectangle box. Read only.
   left - float - X-coordinate, relative to the viewport origin, of the left of the rectangle box. Read only.
   bottom - float - Y-coordinate, relative to the viewport origin, of the bottom of the rectangle box. Read only.
   right - float - X-coordinate, relative to the viewport origin, of the right of the rectangle box. Read only.

methods.name: _calculateTextHeight
methods.description: Returns height of SVG text element.

methods.name: _calculateTextWidth
methods.description: Returns width of SVG text element.

methods.name: _reconcileValue
methods.description:
Reconcile the incoming value on an element's attribute
This is necessary because some values may come in as one type but
need to be interpreted as another type.

methods.name: _ensureMinimum
methods.description: Ensures that a Number is equal to or greater than a min.

methods.name: _reconcileWidth
methods.description: Reconciles the value assigned to width.

methods.name: _reconcileHeight
methods.description: Reconciles the value assigned to height.

methods.name: _reconcileDimensionValue
methods.description: Reconciles the value assigned to height or width.

methods.name: _getAutoValue
methods.description:
Returns the 'automatic' value for height or width based on
parent node dimensions.

methods.name: _getElementPadding
methods.description: Returns the padding of an element's computed style.

methods.name: _setDimensions
methods.description:
Sets the dimensions of the component's `this.widthValue`
and `this.heightValue`.

methods.name: syncCSSTheme
methods.description:
Retrieves the CSS style variables set on this element and applies them
to the appropriate properties, triggering a redraw.

methods.name: _debounceSyncCSSTheme
methods.description:
Debounced function call for `syncCSSTheme` method. Loops through available
style variables to apply them to appropriate objects.

methods.name: _applyStyleVariables
methods.description:
Called when there is at least one style variable applied (the first is
expected to be named `--px-vis-series-color-0`). Loops through each
style variable in the format `--px-vis-series-color-[n]` and applies
the resulting values and series color order to the element. Stops looping
through style variables when it finds a gap.

methods.name: _colorHexToRgb
methods.description: Converts a hex-format color to RGB.

methods.name: _checkIfDevSetSeriesColorOrder
methods.description: Compares seriesColorOrder property value to the seriesColorOrder to determine if the dev set their own override.

methods.name: _getDataVisColor
methods.description: Returns the correct color for a particular index.

params.name: index
params.description: The index of the color to retrieve

return.desc: The found color in RGB format

methods.name: _calcIndex
methods.description:
Calculates the index. When we run out of indices, it loops back over
valid indices.

methods.name: _getColor
methods.description:
Retrieves the colors for the chart at index `i`. Handles a few cases
where colors can be configured for the chart:


# Case 1: Developer sets the `colors` attribute

The element could be used with a `colors` attribute:

```
  <px-simple-horizontal-bar-chart colors=['#aaa','#bbb','#ccc'] ...>
  </px-simple-horizontal-bar-chart>
```

If it is used with a `colors` attribute and a theme, the theme is
overriden and ignored:

```
  <style>
    :root {
      --px-vis-series-color-0: #aaa;
      --px-vis-series-color-1: #bbb;
      --px-vis-series-color-2: #ccc;
      ...
    };
  </style>
  <px-simple-horizontal-bar-chart ...>
  </px-simple-horizontal-bar-chart>
```

In this case, method loops through the `colors` attribute to retrieve
colors using `_getLocalColor`.


# Case 2: Developer does not set `colors` attribute

The element could be used without a `colors` attribute or theme:

```
  <px-simple-horizontal-bar-chart colors=['#aaa','#bbb','#ccc'] ...>
  </px-simple-horizontal-bar-chart>
```

Or it could be used without a `colors` attribute and with a theme:

```
  <style>
    :root {
      --px-vis-series-color-0: #aaa;
      --px-vis-series-color-1: #bbb;
      --px-vis-series-color-2: #ccc;
      ...
    };
  </style>
  <px-simple-horizontal-bar-chart ...>
  </px-simple-horizontal-bar-chart>
```

In this case, method returns the default or theme colors by calling
`_getDataVisColor` (from `pxSimpleChartCommonBehavior`) to get the
data vis colors supplied by `PxSimpleChartCommonBehavior.colors`.

methods.name: _getLocalColor
methods.description:
Loops through the supplied colors in `colors` attribute and returns
the color at `index`.

methods.name: _getBarLabelWidth
methods.description: TODO: write this function to calculate based on label text strings

methods.name: _getMaxLegendColumns
methods.description:
_getMaxLegendColumns() calculates the number of columns necessary
depends on variables legendPadding, legendColumnWidth,
this.heightValue, this.widthValue

methods.name: _getLegendHeight
methods.description: _getLegendHeight() calculates the necessary height of legend

methods.name: _percentagesNeedFloatingPoint
methods.description: returns boolean defining need for floating point in percentage label
